use_case_in_charting.description: Specifies the use case: QUES (Questionnaire), SA (Structured Assessment), EXAM (Physical Exam), or ROS (Review of Systems).

code_system.description: The coding system used for the questionnaire.

code.description: The assigned code for the questionnaire.

can_originate_in_charting.description: Specifies if the questionnaire can be initiated from charting.

search_tags.description: Keywords to facilitate searching for the questionnaire.

scoring_code_system.description: The coding system used for the scoring.

scoring_code.description: The assigned code for scoring, if applicable.

content.description: Additional content or instructions related to the questionnaire. Recommended to leave blank if not applicable.

prologue.description: Text displayed at the beginning of the questionnaire to provide context to the user.

use_in_shx.description: Determines if completion information should be displayed in the Social History (SHX) section.

name.description: Name of the Question. This is the text displayed when the command is selected.

code_system.description: The coding system used for the question.

code.description: The assigned code for the question. Codes should be unique within the same questionnaire.

code_description.description: A description of the assigned code.

content.description: The text displayed when the command is printed. Should match 'name'.

responses_type.description: Response type: SING (Single Select), MULT (Multi Select), TXT (Free Text).

use_in_shx.description: Determines if the response should be shown in the Social History (SHX) section.

name.description: For SING/MULT, this is the text that will be displayed for each response. For TXT, use 'TXT'.

code.description: The assigned code for the response. No response codes should be reused within the same question.

code_description.description: A description of the assigned code.

value.description: For SING/MULT, leave blank if no scoring is desired. If scoring is desired, insert the numerical value assigned.
